item.title: A Spooky Parliament
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Parliament Alone | Huw Parkinson
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Update your ABC News homepage for more local stories
item.description: We've got an ABC News homepage for you. Adjust your settings for the right mix of local and national news.

item.title: In Chinos Man | Huw Parkinson
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NSW Police officers will be allowed to march in Sydney's Mardi Gras parade, but not in uniform
item.description: NSW Police officers will march in the Mardi Gras day parade after the board changed their earlier decision asking them not to attend.

item.title: Call for button battery redesign after new study reveals horrific injuries and fatalities
item.description: A new study reveals the horrific injuries suffered after swallowing or inserting button batteries but manufacturers aren't prioritising their redesign.

item.title: The US election is about style more than substance. It's why Kamala Harris needs to nail her DNC speech in about eight seconds
item.description: When the Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris delivers her speech to the Democratic National Convention today, style will be almost everything.

item.title: Reserve Bank restructure closer to reality after Treasurer Jim Chalmers offers olive branch to Angus Taylor
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

item.title: Have Your Say: What was the issue, policy or event that decided your vote?
item.description: After a five-week campaign, the results are in with Labor returned to government. Is there a policy or issue that swayed your vote? Have Your Say.

item.title: Voters tell ABC's Your Say they want politicians with a vision, not bickering
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they want courage and vision from politicians, not bickering.

item.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
item.description: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

item.title: Australians tell ABC's Your Say they are struggling more than ever with housing costs
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

item.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
item.description: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

item.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election
item.description: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

item.title: Housing advocates seek federal funding election promise for co-op model
item.description: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

item.title: Next-generation voters call for better engagement ahead of federal election
item.description: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

item.title: Melbourne seat of Calwell highlights Labor woes as Gaza pain galvanises Muslim voters
item.description: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

item.title: Cost of living, housing among key concerns in SA marginal seat of Boothby
item.description: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

item.title: Energy projects in South West WA threaten votes for major federal parties
item.description: Australia's two major parties have tied their federal election fates to controversial energy projects in WA's South West where the issues have polarised voters.

item.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?
item.description: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

item.title: Health, climate and community sport: What older voters in the Tasmanian seat of Bass are talking about this election
item.description: The federal seat of Bass is held by a margin of just 1.4 per cent. For these older voters who live in the electorate, health, climate and community sport are the issues that will decide their vote.

item.title: No subscriptions? No problems! Here are some of the best movies and TV series you can watch free
item.description: To mark the start of NAIDOC Week, we've collated some of the most joyous, dramatic and vital screen work from First Nation creatives (and it's all free to enjoy!)

item.title: Trading in Chaos
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: How the dream Spanish holiday became a nightmare for locals
item.description: Spain could soon overtake France as the most visited country in the world and locals have had enough.

item.title: Sergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas to return to Formula 1 with Cadillac
item.description: Former grand prix champions Sergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas are confirmed as the debut line-up for Formula 1's new team, Cadillac.

item.title: Oscar Piastri escapes F1 penalty after leaving pit box early in Italian Grand Prix practice
item.description: Formula 1 World Championship leader Oscar Piastri has an eventful day at Italian Grand Prix practice, escaping with a reprimand after a pit-lane offence.

item.title: Researchers have counted superb fairy-wrens at National Botanical Gardens for 40 years — 2025 was 'confronting'
item.description: The ACT's superb fairy-wren population has declined by 60 per cent since counting began in the 1980s, but this last winter the figures were even worse, new research has revealed.

item.title: The pros and cons of the expanded home buyer scheme
item.description: The revamped scheme has come into effect, with first home buyers of all income levels now able to purchase a property with only a 5 per cent deposit. Here are all the changes explained.

item.title: Brewer stages beer boycott over Kangaroo Island ferry's 'ridiculous' fares
item.description: A Kangaroo Island brewer says he will no longer supply beer to the island's ferry service, amid a growing outcry over the high cost of fares to the popular international tourism destination.

item.title: Annabel Kennedy eyes F1 Academy after becoming first female to stand on Indian F4 podium
item.description: With success at home and abroad, Annabel Kennedy is part of a growing number of Australian women and girls making their mark in motorsport.

item.title: Advocates say First Nations children's commissioner must have power to make change
item.description: Governments have been unable to reduce the rates of First Nations children in out-of-care and youth detention. Advocates say the new children's commissioner needs the power to hold them to account.

item.title: Sick sea turtle rescued from algal bloom recovering at Adelaide Zoo
item.description: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

item.title: Donald Trump to impose new 100 per cent tariffs on China after Beijing restricts rare earths
item.description: The US President takes to Truth Social to say he sees "no reason" to meet Xi Jinping after Beijing's "hostile" move to restrict rare-earth exports.

item.title: Hackers release Qantas customers' data on dark web
item.description: Hackers have released personal data from Qantas customers onto the dark web, following a cyber attack in July.

item.title: What time is the 2025 Bathurst 1000? How can I watch the Supercars at Bathurst?
item.description: The 2025 Bathurst 1000 starts on Sunday morning. Here's all you need to know before the 68th running of the iconic endurance race.

item.title: Diane Keaton, star of Annie Hall, The Godfather films dies at 79
item.description: The unexpected news of Keaton's passing has been met with shock around the world, with stars remembering their time with the actor.

item.title: Committee formally recommends NT government adopt voluntary assisted dying
item.description: On the verandah of their Darwin home, Judy Dent held her husband's hand as he became the first person in the world to die through legally accessible voluntary assisted dying. That world-first would not be possible in the Northern Territory today.

item.title: Hamas releases all remaining Israeli hostages in Gaza, IDF confirms
item.description: Israel says Hamas has handed over all 20 living hostages in the first phase of the Israel-Gaza ceasefire agreement.

item.title: When to share the news of a pregnancy with your employer
item.description: Experts on the rules around when you need to inform your employer if you’re planning to take parental leave.

item.title: Roblox 'taken to task' but may not be included in social media ban, says eSafety commissioner
item.description: Australia's eSafety commissioner says her team has "taken Roblox to task" over its risk of exposing children to harm but warned the online gaming platform may not be included in the upcoming social media ban.

item.title: Suggestion AFLW being used as a 'trial run' for new rules causes frustration
item.description: Collingwood's Tarni White says it feels as though the women's competition is being used as a trial run for new rules before they are implemented into the men's league.

item.title: Victory in Socceroos' friendly against United States could ease World Cup draw
item.description: The Socceroos' friendly against the United States is a positive step in their World Cup preparation, while a positive result could also influence their tournament draw.

item.title: Concerns teenagers in regional West Australia face further isolation as social media ban looms
item.description: Advocates are concerned rural and remote children will experience compounding challenges with the looming social media ban for people under 16.

item.title: Senior conservative James Paterson cautions Liberal Party against splitting
item.description: In a major address to his party, James Paterson says "marginal" voices agitating for the Liberal party to split must be kept on the sidelines, cautioning it would spell "disaster".

item.title: Five takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum
item.description: An emotional plea to the country, concerns about privacy and how Australia's social media ban will actually work. These are the key takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum.

item.title: Failure to declare tests after urinary tract infection sees cancer patient's insurance voided
item.description: A terminal cancer patient is told her failure to declare a UTI has voided her insurance policies, leaving her struggling to pay her mortgage and care for her children in her final days.

item.title: Gaps in cyberbullying reporting leave parents feeling lost, struggling to find answers
item.description: Parents and carers are frustrated by what they say is a lack of support when trying to report several Instagram accounts targeting children under the age of 17 over the school holidays.

item.title: The US has dropped out of the top 10 most powerful passports — but where does Australia rank?
item.description: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

item.title: How long does it take to acclimatise to a new place when the weather is very different?
item.description: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

item.title: UK social media star 'Big John' Fisher being deported from Australia over visa issues
item.description: British social media star "Big John" says he is being deported from Australia after apparently failing to comply with visa requirements.

item.title: Australia sees opportunity in China-US rare earths dispute
item.description: Trump may have expressed "shock", but his administration is clearly not surprised at China's willingness to flex its dominance on rare earths.

item.title: Historic Number 12 Squadron returns as Australia expands anti-submarine capability
item.description: The federal government has re-established the Number 12 Squadron in SA at the same time as Australia's anti-submarine capability is expanding with the arrival of new aircraft.

item.title: Soldier killed in vehicle rollover during army training in north Queensland
item.description: The Department of Defence says an Australian soldier has died after a single-vehicle rollover during training at the Australian Army's Townsville Field Training Area.

item.title: Tasma Walton and Robbie Arnott share $100,000 ARA Historical Novel Prize
item.description: Robbie Arnott's Dusk about twins hunting a puma in Tasmania, and Tasma Walton's I Am Nannertgarrook about an Aboriginal woman kidnapped and sold into slavery, have tied to win the ARA Historical Novel Prize.

item.title: WWII shipwrecks a 'ticking time bomb' for Federated States of Micronesia
item.description: The Federated States of Micronesia's biggest tourism asset has become one of its largest threats, with as much as 22 million litres of oil from World War II shipwrecks slowly leaking into the ocean.

item.title: 'Dangerously low' funding to Tasmanian arts sector creating reputational damage, minister warned
item.description: "Dangerously low" arts sector funding has rendered the Tasmanian industry "highly vulnerable", with funding stagnant since 2016-17, the state government has conceded.

item.title: Jim Chalmers and Tony Burke are in a long race for prime position
item.description: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.

item.title: ASX slips as gold price surges to new record above $US4,300 — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market falls after a downbeat session on Wall Street, weighed down by a sell-off across US regional bank stocks. Gold jumped to a new record high, above $US4,300 an ounce, as investors flocked to safe haven assets amid US-China trade tensions.

item.title: BHP vs China Inc: What the iron ore dispute says about Australia's present and future
item.description: The resolution of negotiations between Australian mining giant BHP and China's state-backed iron ore buyer China Mineral Resources Group could reshape not just the resources industry, but also international trade flows, global markets, and the relationship between China and the West.

item.title: Dangerous flammable cladding still not removed from dozens of NSW high-rise apartment buildings
item.description: Dozens of high-rise apartment buildings across the state are still covered in flammable cladding as the NSW government's scheme has failed to fix them on schedule.

item.title: How a 15yo autistic boy tinkering in his bedroom triggered WA's biggest ever data breach
item.description: Joshua's "passion project" with a radio scanner led to one of WA's most significant public health data breaches. His story highlights the challenges confronting autistic people caught up in the legal system.

item.title: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74
item.description: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.

item.title: Defence in talks to support Gaza peace plan but Australia says no request yet
item.description: Australia's defence force has had discussions with the Unted States to provide support for its Gaza peace plan but the government says no formal request has been made yet.

item.title: Virtual emergency department a lifeline for patients in regional areas
item.description: A virtual emergency room app created during the pandemic could help bridge healthcare gaps in regional Victoria. But more patients need to dial-in and use the resource.

item.title: Indigiearth founder inspires Indigenous women to chase business dreams
item.description: Sharon Winsor is honoured for her pioneering work in native Australian cuisine.

item.title: 'No doubt' Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump will discuss critical minerals: Chalmers
item.description: Anthony Albanese will "no doubt" use a meeting with Donald Trump next week to discuss critical minerals, the treasurer says as he dismisses a call for Australia to "decouple" with China over rare earth materials.

item.title: Ways to increase safety on a first date and red flags to watch for
item.description: Both people involved in a date are responsible for creating a safe environment, experts say.

item.title: Europe unveils plans for 'drone wall' to shield continent from Russian threats
item.description: The European Commission unveils plans for its so-called "drone wall", which is part of a range of initiatives to get the continent ready to defend itself by 2030.

item.title: Video of attempted strip search that breached Aboriginal woman's human rights made public
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Wayne Swan steps down as Labor president urging party to focus on membership boost
item.description: Labor party president Wayne Swan will step down next July and has warned the ALP must boost membership if it is to survive into the future.

item.title: Wittenoom asbestos contamination prompts legal threat from Banjima traditional owners
item.description: After decades of disconnection, the traditional owners of Wittenoom say they are prepared to take legal action to ensure the area is properly remediated so they can return to country.

item.title: Prince Andrew giving up his royal titles and honours after speaking with King Charles
item.description: King Charles's brother has come under significant pressure after being linked to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and his ties to China.

item.title: Video appears to show March for Australia organiser coordinating with Neo-Nazi
item.description: A previously unreported video has emerged appearing to show a key March for Australia organiser coordinating with a Neo-Nazi at the first rally in Sydney in August, ABC NEWS Verify has found.

item.title: Administrative Review Tribunal swamped by surging demand, more than 100 members short
item.description: The Administrative Review Tribunal was set up to resolve issues with its predecessor, but has struggled with staffing and long wait times over its first year.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu's name prompted boos in Israel but is it a signal he has lost favour?
item.description: As the dust settles on the ceasefire and hostage exchange deal, the question arises as to whether the partial resolution could deliver Benjamin Netanyahu a bounce in the polls.

item.title: Sydney Games' impact on Paralympic athletes Kurt Fearnley, Louise Sauvage and Lisa Llorens
item.description: The Sydney Paralympic was a watershed moment for the Paralympic movement. A quarter of a century later, Kurt Fearnley, Louise Sauvage and Lisa Llorens reflect on the Games that changed everything.

item.title: Trump tells Zelenskyy and Putin to 'stop right now at the battle line'
item.description: The Ukrainian president offers the US thousands of military drones in exchange for American Tomahawk missiles, but Donald Trump says he wants to end the war "without thinking about Tomahawks".

item.title: Trump 'risking full-fledged war' against Venezuela as US military action escalates
item.description: The US military has launched six strikes on Venezuelan vessels the Trump administration claims were involved in drugs trafficking, and some are warning the intervention is threatening to spark an all-out war.

item.title: Protesters clash with police as Bangladesh's political parties agree to pathway for reform
item.description: Tear gas and stun grenades were used to disperse hundreds of protesters who were calling for more provisions for those who helped oust the former government of Sheikh Hasina.

item.title: Former Trump adviser John Bolton pleads not guilty to sharing classified information
item.description: John Bolton has become one of Donald Trump's most vocal critics after he was ousted from the US president's administration during his first term.

item.title: Hospital in the Home program helping young man with agoraphobia who 'cut himself off from the world'
item.description: Tom French's agoraphobia meant he couldn't leave the house to access the mental health care he needed, but a Hospital in the Home program means the care is coming to him.

item.title: Pakistani soldiers killed by suicide bomb near Afghanistan border
item.description: The attack on a military base near the Afghanistan border comes as Taliban and Pakistani officials say a peace deal has been extended.

item.title: Tool's Maynard James Keenan on touring Australia, making wine and martial arts
item.description: The alt-metal band's frontman is a world-class multi-tasker. He tells us how he balances it all.

item.title: Greek-inspired lamb kebabs with olive potatoes baked in the oven - ABC News
item.description: The lamb is fuss-free and full of flavour. No barbecue needed — the oven takes care of everything.

item.title: From a Springsteen biopic to a doggy horror: here are the movies out in October
item.description: From the highly anticipated Bruce Springsteen biopic to a horror movie from the viewpoint of the family pup, here are the films filling up cinemas in October.

item.title: Trump commutes former Republican George Santos's federal fraud jail sentence
item.description: George Santos, a former Republican Congressman who is serving more than seven years in a US prison, was charged with stealing from donors, fraud and lying to Congress.

item.title: Anti-bullying report outlines national strategy to crack down on behaviour
item.description: Australian schools will need to initiate action against a bullying complaint within two days of a reported incident as part of a new national plan to tackle bullying.

item.title: Max Verstappen claims sprint pole ahead of Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri at US F1 Grand Prix
item.description: Max Verstappen topples McLaren pair Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris to claim pole position for the sprint race at the United States Grand Prix.

item.title: Coroner finds snakebite death of 11yo Tristian Frahm preventable
item.description: The death of an 11-year-old Queensland boy from a snakebite may have been prevented had he received early medical attention, according to the findings of an inquest.

item.title: A history of the Israeli settler movement in the Occupied Palestinian Territory
item.description: Since October 7, tensions have been rising between Palestinians and Israeli settlers in the Occupied Palestinian Territory.

item.title: Gungahlin United Football Club to fold after losing NPL licence, leaving 2,000 grassroots players club-less
item.description: Just last year, the club won the league, and a former president was jailed for stealing $20k. Now they are going to fold.

item.title: Shohei Ohtani dominates to send Dodgers through to World Series after defeating Brewers
item.description: Shohei Ohtani propels the Los Angeles Dodgers back to the World Series with a two-way performance for the ages to clinch the National League Championship.

item.title: Who is Prince Andrew? Why is he giving up his royal title?
item.description: The third-born child of Queen Elizabeth II will still be referred to as a prince and is expected to continue living in his Windsor mansion.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce hasn't quit the Nationals yet but he's got one foot out the door
item.description: In declaring he won't be recontesting his lower house seat and letting speculation run that he might jump ship for One Nation, Barnaby Joyce is declaring he's had enough with the Nationals under David Littleproud.

item.title: Kangaroos defeat Crows by 40-points to move closer to winning record as Saints, Dockers and Demons notch victories
item.description: North Melbourne moves one victory away from equalling the all-time VFL/AFL and AFLW winning record with a 40-point drubbing of Adelaide as St Kilda moves closer to a maiden finals appearance.

item.title: Ka Ying Rising wins $20 million The Everest at Randwick
item.description: Ka Ying Rising produces a storming finish to claim victory in the world's richest horse race, The Everest.

item.title: NT chief minister claims tough-on-crime approach has led to 'significant' crime drop
item.description: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro says the Country Liberal Party's tough-on-crime approach "is working". But after two teens broke into a play centre and left a trail of destruction, operator Steve Mason is not convinced.

item.title: Chinese Communist Party's Central Committee set for major shake-up at plenum meeting
item.description: A key meeting of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee is expected to include a major shake-up of President Xi Jinping's inner circle.

item.title: Collingwood cult hero Mason Cox not offered new contract for 2026 AFL season
item.description: Mason Cox, the first American to become an AFL regular, confirms he will not be with the Magpies in 2026.

item.title: Jamie Melham creates Caulfield Cup history after riding Half Yours to victory
item.description: Jamie Melham breaks new ground as the first female jockey to win the Caulfield Cup in its 149-year history, steering favourite Half Yours to victory in the $5 million handicap.

item.title: Jack Miller eyeing breakthrough MotoGP podium at Australian Grand Prix
item.description: Jack Miller qualifies in the front row for Sunday's Australian Grand Prix — the first Aussie to do so since Casey Stoner in 2012.

item.title: Israel identifies remains of 10th hostage handed over by Hamas as 76-year-old Eliyahu Margalit
item.description: Eliyahu Margalit's body was found after two bulldozers ploughed up pits in the earth in the city of Khan Younis.

item.title: Death doulas, family-led funerals and the deathcare movement hope to change the way we die
item.description: For many, voluntary assisted dying has come to symbolise control over how life ends. Yet dying well isn't just about those final hours. That's where a deathwalker like Zenith can help.

item.title: China's economic slowdown has become its diplomatic weapon in the Pacific
item.description: For Australia and the US, the Pacific is no longer a comfortable backyard — it's a battleground of credibility.

item.title: The deep Indigenous history of Australia deserves to be up in lights
item.description: We've flipped the script to put Indigenous Australians back at the centre of telling their own stories.

item.title: Anthony Albanese is set to sit down with Donald Trump. What can he learn from other world leaders?
item.description: As other world leaders have discovered, a visit to Donald Trump's White House can become an unpredictable, if not uncomfortable, encounter.

item.title: BOM's first long-range summer forecast shows increased chance of extreme heat
item.description: Hot nights coupled with high daytime temperatures could see Australia heading into an extremely hot summer, BOM's first long-range forecast indicates.

item.title: Native mussel restoration project supported by Victor Harbor community
item.description: Victor Harbor was one of the first areas affected by SA's harmful algal bloom. Now its citizens are funding and supporting research into rebuilding native mussel populations as it looks to the future.

item.title: Hard Quiz Kids: Who says trivia is just for grown-ups? It's time to put your thinking cap on
item.description: Hard Quiz Kids is here again, and we're gifting you a bunch of straightforward questions. Don't embarrass yourself.

item.title: After Ukraine, Finland hopes it won't be Putin's next target
item.description: Blasted into the bedrock, deep below the streets of Helsinki, these massive bunkers are currently used for recreation. Their primary function, however, is much more sinister: preparing for a Russian invasion.

item.title: China's 'special forces'-style tourists packing big itineraries in small budgets
item.description: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

item.title: How Mother Teresa helped Steve Waugh channel his 'power' for children in need
item.description: When Steve Waugh retired from cricket, he knew he wanted to use his influence to make a difference. It was meeting Mother Teresa that made him realise his new path.

item.title: Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri crash in Formula 1 US Grand Prix sprint race
item.description: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris have once again made contact with each other in a Formula 1 race, this time taking each other out at the sprint race of the US Grand Prix, just two weeks after their collision in Singapore.

item.title: 'Gellung Warl' and other Victorian Aboriginal words that are part of Australia's first Treaty
item.description: Victoria's first Treaty with First Peoples' was debated in state parliament last week. The Treaty introduces some Victorian Aboriginal words you may not have heard before — here's how to say them and what they mean.

item.title: Mural of Sydney's queer history removed from Surry Hills Police Station days after going up
item.description: The artwork, Queer Sydney: A History, was hung at Surry Hills Police Station, metres from where the annual Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras parade is held.

item.title: Aussie Bird Count brings together students, photographers and nature-lovers
item.description: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

item.title: 'No Kings' protest crowds gather across the US against Donald Trump's leadership
item.description: Organisers say the rallies reflect frustration over the Trump administration's prosecutions of the president's perceived enemies, immigration raids and the sending of troops into US cities.
